DOC.brief_summary: This is a prospective, randomized, open-label, blinded-evaluator study that will evaluate the effectiveness of a surgical sealant (CoSeal) composed of biocompatible polyethylene glycol on the formation of mediastinal and pericardial adhesions in children undergoing staged surgical reconstruction (potential procedures include: Blalock-Taussig Type Operation, Classical Glenn Procedure, Bidirectional Glenn Procedure, Norwood). Additionally, bleeding will be evaluated by drainage post-operatively through surgical site drainage output.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of CoSeal on Bleeding & Adhesions in Pediatric Heart Surgery
DOC.criteria: Have an acceptable surrogate capable of giving consent on the subject's behalf. Pediatric patients ages 0 17 Have a cardiac disease which requires staged cardiac surgery and resternotomy Nonemergent state or emergent state with sufficient time to educate and consent An immune system disorder Unplanned reoperation Known hypersensitivity to components in CoSeal Patients undergoing reoperation less than 3 months after the primary surgery
